chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey A Edlebeck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey A Edlebeck is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey A Edlebeck was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Casey A Edlebeck was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Casey A Edlebeck was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Casey A Edlebeck was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Casey A Edlebeck was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing and Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations /s/ TTF 03/06/17

1:50 p.m. Defendant Casey A Edlebeck in court. ADA Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's motion for IID Exemption is heard today. Court questions as his reasons for requesting the exemption. Defendant states he is not eligible for a license, is not driving his vehicle, and can't afford the IID from now to the time when he gets his license. And when he gets his license the time that he couldn't drive doesn't count toward the period of the IID requirement and would need to continue paying even more.
BY THE COURT: No action by the Court.
Review hearing on May 26, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Application for IID Exemption While in Custody at Portage County Jail

Defendant Casey A Edlebeck in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:00 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Amended Information provided to the Court. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Dismissed 
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - Guilty
Count 5 - Guilty
Count 6 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 & 6 and Count 2 is dismissed. .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
*Impose/Stay a 100 day jail sentence with huber privileges  granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
*First half in jail and the second half on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Placed on Probation for 36 months
***Conditions of Probation:
*45 days conditional jail with huber privileges  granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling, treatment and any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
*First half in jail and the second half on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
*3 days jail credit 
*Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
*Must report today for start date.
*Pay fine of $600 plus costs - totalling $1,744.00
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*24 months DL revocation
*24 months IID on any vehicles titled in defendants name 
*Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

Count 2 - Dismissed 

Count 3 -
*Impose/Stay a 6 month jail sentence concurrent to Count 1& 5 with huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling, treatment and any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
*First half in jail and the second half on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
*Placed on 36 months of probation to run concurrent
*Comply with conditions set forth in Count 1
*50 hours community service - 1/2 with the Portage County Parks Department 
*AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Pay Court costs -victim witness surcharge, filing fee and DNA Surcharge 

Count 4 -
*Impose/Stay a 30 day jail sentence concurrent to Count 6 but consecutive to Counts 1, 3 & 5 with huber privileges  granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling, treatment and any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
*First half in jail and the second half on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
*Placed on 36 months probation to run concurrent 
*Comply with conditions set forth in Counts 1 & 3
*Pay Court costs - victim witness surcharge, filing fee and DNA Surcharge 

Count 5 -
*Impose/Stay a 6 month jail sentence to run concurrent to Count 1& 3 with huber privileges  granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling, treatment and any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
*First half in jail and the second half on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
*Placed on probation for 36 months to run concurrent
*Comply with conditions set forth in Counts 1 & 3 
*Pay Court costs - victim witness surcharge, filing fee and DNA Surcharge 

Count 6 -
*Impose/Stay a 30 day jail sentence to run concurrent to Count 4 but consecutive to Counts 1, 3 & 5 with huber privileges  granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling, treatment and any other reasons the sheriff will allow.
*First half in jail and the second half on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
*Placed on 36 months probation to run concurrent
*Comply with conditions as set forth in Counts 1 & 3
*Pay Court costs - victim witness surcharge, filing fee and DNA Surcharge 

**Any bond monies to be applied to fines, court costs and restitution

Defendant Record Update
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
Pre-trial conference at 01-11-2016 08:30 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference at 12-07-2015 08:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Casey A Edlebeck in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:05 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 11-23-2015 03:00 pm

2:37 p.m. Defendant Casey A Edlebeck in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Casey A Edlebeck
Current: 2824 Henrietta St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2015)
Prior: 2824 Henrietta St, Stevens Point, WI 54482
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-02-2015 01:30 pm

3:08 P.M. Defendant Casey A Edlebeck in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint 15CF390 and 15CM401. (if any warrants out there then they be quashed)
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
*Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
Bonds continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
This bond covers both 15GF333 & 15CM401.

Both files heard: 15GF333, 15CM401

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of OWI-3rd offense, Possession of Controlled Substances/Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond in 15GF333 with conditions as stated and that the bond in 15CM401 be covered by the bond in 15GF333.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  10/19/2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

BY THE COURT:  The warrant in 15CM401 is quashed.
